Name: ArduinoKryptering
Descriptions: Are you a pro in Arduino then this is your event...we will give you a task and you'll code it..flashit..and do it..
Rules: Maximum of 3 members in a team
Team members can be from different colleges
All students with a valid identity card from their respective educational institution and a valid DYUKSHA ID are eligible to participate in the event
Participants are expected to have immense knowledge on coding and encryption
If number of groups is more, a prelim will be conducted for elimination
The problem statement and deﬁnition will be given at the spot of event
Team completing task successfully in least possible time will be the winners
The test cases of the problem statement can and will be changed dynamically in order to test the efﬁciency of solutions in case the leader board is cluttered
In case of any ties, more efﬁcient solutions and further more readable solutions will be given preference
Judges and event coordinators decisions are ﬁnal and binding on all participants
Members should have a laptop each
Basic electronic components required and Arduino will be provided
Use of components and library ﬁles other than provided are not allowed
Contestants should report at the venue on time else will lead to disqualiﬁcation
Use of mobile phone and internet at the time of event is not allowed
Any malpractices found will lead to disqualiﬁcation
The organizers have full rights to call off the event if the required number of entries is not met; if that is the case the registered participants will be informed at the earliest
Change in rules, if any will be highlighted on the website and notiﬁed to the registered teams
